**Course Objective**

This course aims to build and strengthen students’ overall English proficiency in the four areas of listening, speaking, reading and writing. Through extensive course works, students shall be able: (1). to develop their integrated language skills, (2). to hone up their verbal and written communication skills, and (3). to enhance their critical reasoning and analytical abilities. Special emphasis of this course is placed on the development of students’ reading competence. Selected course contents include an array of diverse topics and various genres that will allow students to build their reading comprehensions and skills, gain general knowledge, and expand their vocabulary base. Students are encouraged to take active participations in both in-class and after-class language practices and activities.

Course Requirements and Evaluation

1.  Attendance and Preparation: Students are expected to attend the class well prepared, and to arrive to class on time. Tardiness and absences will affect your final grade. If you miss the class on more than three occasions, you will fail the course. (Official documentation is required for an absence.)
2.  Class Participation and presentations, and English Micro Movie productions and presentations (20%): Active participations in class activities and language practices will foster your real-time communication skills and critical thinking, which will lead to a greater improvement in your English language learning. Therefore, you are required to actively participate in classroom activities such as pair/group discussions and make multiple oral presentations on assigned or chosen topics. In addition, in this semester, we will have an in-class English Micro Movie contest. Students are required to produce/show an English Micro Movie about 5 minutes in length per episode in class. 微電影製作比賽：各組學生集思廣益，內容不拘，撰寫英文腳本拍攝微電影，影片長度五分鐘，內容以全英語呈現，輔以英語字幕。
3.  After-Class Listening & Speaking Practice (20%):

a). Weekly Listening Practice—Students will be required to practice their listening skills on a weekly basis by utilizing the audio and video resources provided at the Self-Access English Center (Located in 樸101). It is expected that students complete 3 times of listening practices before the mid-term and another 3 times afterwards, for a total of 6 visits. 

b). Weekly Speaking Practice—Students will be required to practice their English speaking skills at the English Chat Room. The minimum requirement for the speaking practices is 3 times before the mid-term and another 3 times after the midterm.

1.  Three Advanced Quizzes (60%) (20% each)

**Extra Bonuses:**

(1). Visit the English Self-Access center and/or the English Chat room more than the minimum requirement.

(2). Participate or/and win a prize in any one type of English competitions held on campus (e.g. the drama competition, the writing contest...etc.)
